wikipedia_page.main: James Edward Gordon (UK, 1913–1998) was one of the founders of materials science and biomechanics, and a well-known author of three books on structures and materials, which have been translated in many languages and are still widely used in schools and universities.

link_mentions.page: A. A. Griffith Medal and Prize

response: * The New Science of Strong Materials or Why You Don't Fall Through the Floor by J. E. Gordon (1968)
